title: Will Simone Biles win another Olympic all-around gymnastics title by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Simone Biles wins another Olympic all-around gymnastics title by August 31, 2024. If she does not win another title by this date, the question will resolve as NO.

article_information.article_description: Simone Biles edged Rebeca Andrade of Brazil during a tense all-around gymnastics final Thursday to become a two-time Olympic champion. Biles’ total of 59.131 was just ahead of Andrade at 57.932. That's one of the closest calls Biles has ever…
article_information.article_title: Simone Biles edges Brazil's Rebeca Andrade for her second Olympic all-around gymnastics title
article_information.article_content:
PARIS (AP) Simone Biles remains peerless. Even when she's not quite perfect.
The American gymnastics star edged Brazil's Rebeca Andrade during a tense Olympic all-around final Thursday. Biles' total… [+4511 chars]

title: Will Rebeca Andrade win an Olympic all-around gymnastics title by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Rebeca Andrade wins an Olympic all-around gymnastics title by August 31, 2024. If she does not win an Olympic all-around title by this date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will India and Vietnam double their trade and investment by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India and Vietnam have doubled their trade and investment compared to their levels as of October 2023. Official announcements from either the Indian or Vietnamese government, or reports from at least two reputable news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post) confirming the doubling of trade and investment will be considered valid for resolution.

article_information.article_description: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
article_information.article_title: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
article_information.article_content:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.

title: Will the number of Americans filing for jobless claims remain below 250,000 for at least 10 consecutive weeks by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the number of Americans filing for jobless claims remains below 250,000 for at least 10 consecutive weeks. Jobless claims data must be reported by the U.S. Department of Labor.

article_information.article_description: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
article_information.article_title: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
article_information.article_content:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.

title: Will the proposed rule to ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children be approved by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the proposed rule by the U.S. Department of Transportation to ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children is approved and enacted. The rule must be officially implemented and announced by the U.S. Department of Transportation or another relevant authority. If the rule is not approved by this date, the question will resolve as NO.

article_information.article_description: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
article_information.article_title: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
article_information.article_content:

title: Will any major U.S. airline voluntarily implement the proposed seating rule for parents and children by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any major U.S. airline voluntarily implements the proposed rule by the U.S. Department of Transportation to ban charging parents to sit with their children. A 'major U.S. airline' is defined as one of the top 10 U.S. airlines by passenger traffic. The implementation must be officially announced by the airline and verified by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If no such implementation occurs by this date, the question will resolve as NO.
